text: hey guys it's angel Chinese New Year is
just around the corner and this year it
is February 8th of 2016 which just so
happens to be a Monday now because it's
the year the monkey that pretty much
means you can put bananas and anything
and it'll taste good ok that's probably
a really bad joke so let's cut that one
out anyways if you're wondering why
Chinese New Year is in February and not
in January it's because Chinese New Year
is based off of the lunar calendar
so today I'm going to share with you
eight of my favorite Chinese New Year
recipe ideas now I could have gone with
ten but since eight is a lucky number in
Chinese we are going with eight today
and some of these recipes are recipes
that I've already made and so I'm going
to start a Chinese New Year playlist for
2016 and you'll see that in the
description below but I also has some
new recipes coming up for Chinese near
which I will also include so let's get
started
recipe number 8 the first item on my
list is hot pop now I had hotpot last
year for Chinese New Year and if you've
had hot pot before you'll know why it's
a great family get-together meal I love
how everybody can cook their own meats
vegetables seafood whatever they want
and they come together and cook them
using a shared pot it's just one of
those complete meals where everybody
gets to cook whatever they want and
everybody's happy and talking plus the
soup is amazing so definitely recommend
hotpot next on my list is turnip cakes
in mandarin we call this Luo Bogle now
you can usually find turnip cakes at dim
sum restaurants but I love eating
homemade turnip cakes because it's one
of my childhood foods my grandma makes
the best turnip cakes I have it
amazing turnip cake recipe so you should
definitely try that but it's also
considered good luck food now what's
great about turnip cakes is that you
could make them a few days in advance
then when Chinese New Year comes around
or Chinese near eve comes around you can
always cut them off in slices then pan
fry them and they're ready to eat number
six on my list is whole steamed fish now
don't be intimidated when I say whole
steamed fish because it's considered
good luck food to steam the entire fish
with the head on now stay tuned because
over the next week or two I'm going to
share with you my steamed fish recipe
and I'll show you how to clean prepare
and even how to scheme the fish and the
equipment that you'll need and it'll be
a really nice traditional fish that you
guys can serve for Chinese New Year next
on my list or if you're not into fish
how about chicken I've got two great
chicken recipes one is Hainanese chicken
rice which tastes amazing and also a
five-spice roasted soy chicken both are
whole chicken recipes which is great for
table presentation plus they're just
really flavorful really good chicken
next up on my list are pot stickers or
ducklings now the difference between pot
stickers or dumplings is just the
cooking method pot stickers are
pan-fried while dumplings are boiled but
they're basically the same thing and
another interesting tidbit is that since
pot stickers are shaped similar to that
of a gold piece or money it's considered
good luck
next up is for those of you who want
something simple and easy to make
I recommend a fried rice with either
sausage you can use Chinese sausage or
something more Americanized like a
breakfast sausage
I also recommend serving that with a
stir-fry baby bok choy which is simple
yet very low-key finally the desserts
I love almond cookies and so I have a
recipe for Chinese almond cookies that
I'm going to be sharing with you guys
soon and they're really good so buttery
so addicting so definitely check that
out soon and last but not least is
Chinese New Year cake which is also
known as Union Gao now if you haven't
had Yangon before it kind of tastes like
a warm gooey mochi but this has got to
be the number one traditional Chinese
New Year food so if you have one recipe
to make make sure it's Chinese New Year
cake so those are my eight
recommendations for Chinese near recipes
I'll post links to all of those in the
video description below so don't forget
to check that out and if you are new to
Chinese New Year and you need some
pointers my first one would be how to
wish somebody a Happy New Year in
Mandarin we say Shenyang koala and
depending on your age or your status you
typically give a receive red pocket now
if you don't know what red pockets are I
have a semi humorous video on how to ask
for red pocket Chinese New Year money
anyways I hope you have a lot of fun
trying these recipes and don't forget to
snap a photo and tag me on social media
sharing your dishes with me
and I hope you have a fun and prosperous
chinese here soon inquire left by
